Description: Small fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, showing one line of hieratic text on the outside of the vessel and another line on the inside of the vessel, written in black ink. The line on the outside is quite faint. The sherd belonged to a bowl with a red rim on the inside and edge of it, Nile clay, wheel made.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 233)
